results.title: Kinegraffiti
results.creator_credit: Firebird Films, Arthur Cantrill and Corinne Cantrill
results.brief_description: Experimental film using fireworks, often superimposed and in soft focus, printed in negative form with a black image on a white background. Plucked piano strings reversed xylophone and cymbal with an electronic vibrato effect form the background sound effects.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Firebird Films, Arthur Cantrill and Corinne Cantrill

results.title: Kindred spirits (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Alan Burke and Alan Fisk
results.brief_description: Julie Nelson, a young dancer on the Sydney club circuit, witnesses the drowning of a young man and finds her life falling apart. It is a horrifying experience, but what is even more disturbing is that his presence continues to haunt her. The key to the mystery is held and withheld by an eccentric old lady.

results.title: Kindred
results.brief_description:
A drama about incest based on a number of case studies. Penny tries to make her mother and younger sister face the reality of her situation as a victim of parental incest.
Written by Debra Oswald and starring Alyson Best and Russell Newman.

results.title: Kindred
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Television and Radio School and Julie Money
results.brief_description: A sensitive drama about incest based on a number of case studies. Penny tries to make her mother and younger sister face the reality of her situation as a victim of parental incest. The film is gripping in its portrayal of the helplessness experienced by members of a family confronting the reality of incest. Cast, Alyson Best, Russell Newman, Melissa Jaffer, Julie, Tyler, Nick Holland, Susannah Fowle, Barbra Joss, Harold Kissin. Written by Debra Oswald.

results.title: Kindergarten
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Guy L. Cote
results.brief_description: A camera study of one day in the classroom with kindergarten children, illustrating how the teacher encourages the children to turn their curiosity into questions, and organized group activities and play periods. Filmed at Van Horne Public School, Montreal.

results.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
results.creator_credit: Ealing Studios, Sir Michael Balcon and Robert Hamer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
A genteel mass-murderer is out to heartlessly eliminate the eight relatives standing between him and the family fortune. Alec Guinness plays all eight victims in this witty black comedy. Based on the novel “Noblesse oblige” by Roy Horniman.

results.title: Kimono
results.creator_credit: Iwanami Production and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: This is the modern story of how, when and why the kimono is produced and worn - including wide variety designs, materials, and pattern basically remains the same for infants through to elderly.

results.title: Kimberley: Wandjina country (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Kestrel Film Productions, John Richardson and David Morgan
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Belinda Wright and Stanley Breeden are naturalists and photographers who work with the National Geographic Society. As they become fascinated with the “Wandjina” rock paintings, the viewer also gains some insight into the deep, spiritual relationship the Aboriginal people have with the land.

results.title: Kimberley: Wandjina country
results.creator_credit: Kestrel Film Productions, John Richardson and David Morgan
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Part three of a series of six documentaries that examine the wilderness areas of Australia. Belinda Wright and Stanley Breeden are naturalists and photographers who work for the National Geographic Society. As they become fascinated with the “Wandjina” rock paintings, the viewer also gains some insight into the deep, spiritual relationship the Aboriginal people have with the land. A Teacher’s guide accompanies the video.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kestrel Film Productions, John Richardson and David Morgan
